intro: Chlorophytum kymatodes, commonly known as the curly snake plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its long, arching leaves that curl and twist, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant is evergreen and produces small, white, tubular flowers that emerge from the base of the leaves. It is adapted to thrive in low-light conditions and requires minimal water, making it an ideal houseplant. Its ability to purify indoor air and tolerate neglect has contributed to its popularity among plant enthusiasts.
